sentences.english: no little anecdotes to share with the folks?
sentences.chinese: 就没些个奇闻异事要跟家里人分享的？

sentences.english: Once the story got abroad, I would never hear the last of it.
sentences.chinese: 要是这个奇闻一旦传了出去，就会讨论个没完没了。

sentences.english: Other oddities leak out from the books and the memoirs.
sentences.chinese: 还有一些奇闻逸事从书本和回忆录中泄露出来。

sentences.english: Mr Ramo uses his anecdotes to make some sharp observations.
sentences.chinese: 蓝默先生利用这些奇闻轶事建构出的观察相当犀利。

sentences.english: These humble shepherds were the first to hear and ponder the wondrous news of the birth of Christ.
sentences.chinese: 谦和的牧民们第一次听到并思索着基督诞世之奇闻。

sentences.english: They sat around the campfire telling tall tales about their hunting adventures.
sentences.chinese: 他们围坐在篝火旁讲着自己狩猎冒险的奇闻。

sentences.english: Mr Ramo’s book is full of engaging vignettes like this.
sentences.chinese: 蓝默先生的新书博引旁征这番引人入胜的奇闻逸事。

sentences.english: In 1859, such reports were mostly curiosities.
sentences.chinese: 1859年，这样的报道大多数是奇闻。

sentences.english: Looking into strange and extraordinary stories of ancient times is very interesting.
sentences.chinese: 钩稽古代奇闻轶事是一件很有趣的事。

definition: sth else/a separate matter/not the same thing/with different jobs (not colleagues)/a remarkable thing/sth special/an odd thing/sth strange or incomprehensible
anecdote/lost or apocryphal story about famous person
nothing is too bizarre/full of extraordinary things
variant of 軼聞|轶闻[yi4 wen2]
an eccentric/odd person/person of extraordinary talent
what one has seen and heard/knowledge/one's experience
poetic occasion/elegant situation/in literature, the cue for a poem
to slap the table in amazement (idiom); wonderful!/amazing!
